policy_name: Responsible Use of Artificial Intelligence in Academic Work

scope.jurisdiction: All courses, research, and academic programs at Yale University

preamble: Yale is committed to academic integrity and responsible innovation. AI tools offer tremendous potential for learning and discovery. This policy establishes clear guidelines for ethical AI use that maintain Yale's commitment to genuine scholarship.
core_principles: Authenticity: Academic work must reflect genuine human thinking and effort
Transparency: All AI use must be clearly disclosed
Responsibility: Users must critically evaluate AI outputs for accuracy and bias
Learning: AI should enhance learning, not replace critical thinking

allowed_uses.description: Using AI to understand difficult concepts and course material
examples: Asking ChatGPT to explain a theorem in different ways
Using AI to translate technical jargon into simpler language
Using AI to work through practice problems for understanding

allowed_uses.description: Using AI to improve writing quality, clarity, and organization
examples: Using AI for grammar and style checking
Using AI to improve argument structure
Using AI to ensure clear academic writing
allowed_uses.disclosure_method: Acknowledge AI assistance in footnote or separate statement

allowed_uses.description: Using AI to design research methodology and plan experiments
examples: Using AI to brainstorm research questions
Using AI to review research design approaches
Using AI to identify methodological considerations

allowed_uses.description: Using AI for programming assistance with proper attribution
examples: Using GitHub Copilot with code review
Using AI to generate boilerplate code
Using AI for debugging assistance
allowed_uses.disclosure_method: Code comments with tool and date

allowed_uses.description: Using AI to analyze data and interpret results
examples: Using AI to suggest statistical approaches
Using AI to generate visualizations and interpret patterns
Using AI to check calculations

allowed_uses.description: Using AI to organize, summarize, and synthesize literature
examples: Using AI to summarize academic papers
Using AI to identify research trends
Using AI to organize bibliographies

prohibited_uses.use_case: Submitting AI Output as Own Work
prohibited_uses.description: Presenting AI-generated work as original human work without disclosure
examples: Submitting an AI-written essay without attribution
Turning in AI-generated analysis as your original work
Presenting AI-created research conclusions

prohibited_uses.description: Using AI on assignments explicitly prohibited by instructor
examples: Using AI on take-home exam marked 'AI not permitted'
Using AI when individual work is required
Using AI to circumvent learning objectives
prohibited_uses.consequence: Failing grade on assignment or course

prohibited_uses.description: Using AI to fabricate data, citations, or research findings
examples: Using AI to generate fake experimental results
Creating fabricated citations
Generating misleading data visualizations

prohibited_uses.description: Using AI tools during examinations or assessments
examples: Using ChatGPT during proctored exam
Accessing AI during timed assessments
Using AI during laboratory practical exams

prohibited_uses.description: Using AI to complete work when collaboration is prohibited
examples: Using AI instead of individual work
Using AI to compensate for not doing own work
Using AI when peer collaboration is forbidden

disclosure_statement_template.title: AI Tool Usage Disclosure
disclosure_statement_template.format: Include the following information when using AI:
template: AI Tool(s) Used: [List specific tools and versions]
Purpose(s): [Describe what AI was used for]
Impact on Work: [Explain how AI affected the final product]
Human Review: [Describe what human review/modification was done]
disclosure_statement_template.example: AI Tool Usage Disclosure: ChatGPT-4 was used to help organize the structure of this literature review and suggest relevant themes. All AI-generated summaries were reviewed, modified, and verified for accuracy. Human analysis and critical synthesis are entirely my own. Used January 2025.

before_course: Clearly communicate AI policy expectations in syllabus
Specify whether AI use is permitted, required, or prohibited for each assignment
Provide clear disclosure requirements and examples
during_course: Monitor for suspicious patterns indicating inappropriate AI use
Be attentive to sudden shifts in writing quality or complexity
Watch for content inconsistent with demonstrated class understanding
assessment: Consider requiring AI disclosure statements for major assignments
Use plagiarism detection and AI detection tools when appropriate
Include student understanding verification through follow-up questions or presentations

enforcement.process: Yale's standard academic integrity process applies
enforcement.sanctions: Range from warning to expulsion depending on severity
